background_generator.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 ## @file
00004 # A node that generators a background image. It averages the first five images received on camera/image_raw and saves them to the location indicated by the /background_generator/image_name parameter.
00005 
00006 ## @author Brendan Andrade
00007 
00008 import roslib; roslib.load_manifest('dcsl_vision_tracker')
00009 import rospy
00010 import cv
00011 from sensor_msgs.msg import Image
00012 from cv_bridge import CvBridge, CvBridgeError
00013 
00014 ## This class allows the generator of a background image for use with miabot_tracker.py
00015 class background_generator:
00016     ## Creates the subscriber, sets properties defining how many images to average, and creates teh CvBridge object.
00017     def __init__(self):
00018         self.image_sub = rospy.Subscriber("/camera/image_raw", Image, self.callback)
00019         self.bridge = CvBridge()
00020         self.n = 5
00021         self.count = 1
00022 
00023     ## Callback function for the image subscriber. It adds the received image to the average image and outputs the background image once self.n images have been added.
00024     #
00025     # @param data is the iamge data from the image subscriber.
00026     def callback(self,data):
00027         # Bridge the image from ROS to OpenCV
00028         try:
00029             cv_image = self.bridge.imgmsg_to_cv(data, "mono8")
00030         except CvBridgeError, e:
00031             print e
00032             
00033         # Create the background image object if this is the first trigger of the callback
00034         if self.count == 1:
00035             print "Initializing image"
00036             self.background_image = cv.CreateMat(cv_image.rows, cv_image.cols, cv.CV_64FC1)
00037             cv.SetZero(self.background_image)
00038         
00039         # Add image to total image (Pixel by pixel addition of grayscale values
00040         cv.Acc(cv_image,self.background_image)
00041         
00042         # If self.n images have been added, take average and output
00043         if self.count == self.n:
00044             # For each pixel divide by self.n to find average image
00045             cv.ConvertScale(self.background_image,self.background_image,1.0/float(self.n));
00046             # Get image name and output image
00047             image_name = rospy.get_param('/background_generator/image_name')
00048             cv.SaveImage(image_name,self.background_image)  
00049             print "Background image generated...node shutting down"
00050             # Shutdown node
00051             rospy.signal_shutdown("Background image generated...node shutting down")
00052 
00053         self.count += 1
00054         #Display image in window
00055         cv.ShowImage("Image Window", self.background_image)
00056         cv.WaitKey(3)
00057 
00058 ## Main function triggered when node begins.
00059 #
00060 # Creates the node object and background_generator object.        
00061 def main():
00062     rospy.init_node('background_generator')
00063     bg = background_generator()
00064     try:
00065         rospy.spin()
00066     except KeyboardInterrupt:
00067         print "Shutting down"
00068     cv.DestroyAllWindows()
00069 
00070 if __name__ == '__main__':
00071     print "Starting background generator"
00072     main()
